title: Contribution and legacy of John Wing, 1923-2010
abstract:
Full text currently not available on the LRA. The article is embargoed until March 2012.The death of Professor John Wing, one of the giants of 20thcentury\ud
British and world psychiatry, rightly deserves to be\ud
marked by a tribute in the British Journal of Psychiatry. This\ud
article has been prepared by four people who knew John\ud
personally and through his work, his partner in private and\ud
work life, a colleague in Great Britain and one abroad and a\ud
pupil, which are set out as four separate contributions.\ud
John was born on 22 October 1923. He died on 18 April\ud
2010, aged 87.Peer-reviewe

Full text currently not available on the LRA. The article is embargoed until March 2012.</dc:description><dc:description>
The death of Professor John Wing, one of the giants of 20thcentury\ud
British and world psychiatry, rightly deserves to be\ud
marked by a tribute in the British Journal of Psychiatry. This\ud
article has been prepared by four people who knew John\ud
personally and through his work, his partner in private and\ud
work life, a colleague in Great Britain and one abroad and a\ud
pupil, which are set out as four separate contributions.\ud
John was born on 22 October 1923. He died on 18 April\ud
2010, aged 87.</dc:description><dc:description>
